name: The Heritage Hotel Manila
detail: I stayed at The Herritage for 3 nights and was tottally surprised at the level of service at the hotel. I stayedin a club room and got it super cheap through agoda, and with all the extras included in club, made our stay something we wont forget. Although like some hotels in manila the view from the balcony wasnt anything to brag about, but was nice to have a Balcony all the same because there are not many hotels in manila that do . It is close to SM Mall and everything you need. I highly rate this place and encourage to try the super value for money .

name: Belmont Hotel Manila near NAIA Terminal 3 MNL
detail: This is one of the pricier hotels in Manila as it's near the international airport. My favorite thing about our stay in the hotel was the rooftop view from the top floor of the hotel where the pool was also located. You can lounge there while enjoying the view. They also have a sauna and a gym. The staff was also very helpful. They immediately helped me when I got locked out of my room because the automatic doorknob needed a change in battery. The food at the restaurant was delectable. There's a Starbucks on the same building of the hotel and there are a couple other restaurants around the Resorts World area which are easily accessible from the hotel. This hotel accommodated our last minute booking because our supposed first booking at another hotel also got cancelled last minute. Anyway, this hotel turned out to be better than we've expected and it's a great value for your money.

name: Savoy Hotel Manila near NAIA Terminal 3 MNL
detail: Stayed in this hotel for three times already, and I will definitely come back again . The location is good, just across NAIA terminal 3 (they provide a free shuttle bus every hour from the airport to the hotel. You can find the buses at the arrival gate at the ground floor of the airport). There are some restaurants around the area, spa, nail salons, dental clinic, pharmacy store, laundry shop , walking distance to resorts world wherein there’s also a small shopping mall, there is a near supermarket as well. The breakfast buffet is good, and you won’t get sick of the options because everyday they change the choices. The staffs were also amazing! I left my watch in the room during my first stay and they notified me and gave it back. On my third stay, I asked my mom to wait for me at the hotel since I’ll only arrive in the Philippines after a very long flight and they assisted my mom and allowed her to check-in early while waiting for me to land in Manila. Every time I go back to Manila, I choose this hotel and I highly recommend it.

name: Crimson Hotel Filinvest City Manila
detail: This was an excellent Hotel in terms of quality of decore throughout,staff friendliness, a quiet location of Manila and truly comfortable rooms. My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 days and nights and it was a wonderful experience. We booked through agoda when we saw the hotel had a good special on for a quality King bed room with breakfast and internet. It is distant from Manila and Makarti and the traffic and noise of the city which is exactly what we wanted. It was like a bastion of peace and tranquility with incredible internal surroundings. It is close to a single shopping centre which was very convenient but you dont see it or hear it from the hotel. It gave us the oppertunity to eat out, go to the theatre, do some general shopping but spend the vast majority of the time in our room or in the lounge area of the hotel. As this was in June it was off season for Philippines and the hotel had a worthy deal of AU$100/ night (4,000 pesos)including breakfast and WIFI. The large flat screen TV, King size bed, excellent pillows and linen, very large windows,classy furnishings made this one of the best rooms we have stayed in and we travel twice a year. To cap it off, we were upgraded on arrival to a corner room which is slightly larger, but otherwise is exactly the same. This was a special 3 days and we will stay there again, given a deal or promo is offered. Robert Te - Australia

name: Dusit Thani Manila
detail: My wife and I reside full time in the Philippines and therefore have stayed in many different hotels in Manila. This was the first time we had stayed in the Dusit Thani Manila Hotel and we were thoroughly impressed. From the welcome each time at the front door by Gino the Door Man as we arrived back from shoppimg to the help and support which was extended to us from the Concierge Department and the pleasant smiling faces of all the staff we were made to feel so welcome and were treated all the time as VIP guests. Well done Dusit Thani Manila Hotel! You have got our business from now on and we will be back to stay with you again real soon. Best regards and thank you.

name: Makati Diamond Residences
detail: I have stayed here 3 or 4 times ... It is a wonderful hotel right across the street from Greenbelt Mall, which is also my favorite mall in Philippines with many good restaurants, bars and shops ... the staff is well-trained and friendly ... the hotel sparkles and the rooms are spacious with free mini bars ...I have stayed many times at Shangri La and several times at the Fairmont and Makati Diamond is by far the best value for upscale hotel in Manila... highly recommend

name: New Coast Hotel Manila
detail: FROM PERSONAL EXPERIENCE IS THE BEST HOTEL IN MANILA. VALUE -LOCATION- BEST SRERVICE - CLEANLINESS-FACILITIES. FOOD IN BREAKFAST A AMAZING. THE CLUB ON 10 FLOOR. IS THE BEST. THANKS

name: Diamond Hotel
detail: Breakfast: I have to say, the breakfast menu was top-notch.

name: City Garden GRAND Hotel
detail: I was impressed from the start, good easy and quick check in, a personalised visit by the manager with some cookies were a nice touch. The room was large and extremely comfortable. The beds were great and the pillows too, I had a great sleep. The little things, TV had a huge number of channels to use, tee and coffee facilities, even a wine bottle opener, nick naks in the writing draw to assist you from paper clips to stapler. The bathroom was big and clean. We dinned on the rooftop, the Mongolian BBQ was not the greatest but was good, more spices were needed and more veg's too. The service was great and the ambiance was excellent. Night time above the maddening traffic of Manila was magic. The pool was excellent, while relatively small it was adequate and refreshing. My daughter loved it. Recommend this hotel .. yes definitely. All the staff were great, guys out front, the front desk crew, waiters and waitresses, cleaning staff all were happy, smiling and accommodating. I have finally found a great hotel in Manila, yes I will return.

name: New World Makati Hotel
detail: this is my 8th visit to philippines and i've stayed at 12+ different hotels, 6+ of them 4/5 stars. for value and location this is by far the best hotel in manila. you can save a little more at other hotels in the neighborhood, but end up walking a bit or taking a taxi to entertain yourself. you can spend a lot more money, get more amenities and more comfort, but again, spend some time to get yourself entertained. shangri-la for example is a better hotel, but you will pay for it. dusit sometimes might be cheaper, but it is a cheaper (feel) hotel in what seems to be a back alley. through agoda, you can get excellent deals. for price, location, comfort and safety new world makati is 5 star all the way and an excellent value
